Plot Feature t-SNE

Plot Feature t-SNE

plotFeatureTSNE(object, ...)

# S4 method for seurat
plotFeatureTSNE(object, features, pointSize = 0.5,
  pointAlpha = 0.8, color = ggplot2::scale_color_gradient(low = "lightgray",
  high = "purple"), dark = FALSE, label = TRUE, labelSize = 6L,
  legend = FALSE, returnAsList = FALSE)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
features

Character vector of features (e.g. gene expression, PC scores, number of genes detected).
pointSize

Cell point size.
pointAlpha

Alpha transparency level. Useful when there many cells in the dataset, and some cells can be masked.
color

Color palette to use for points. Defaults to the viridis color palette. Use ggplot2::scale_color_gradient() to easily define your own low/high gradient.
dark

Enable dark mode.
label

Overlay a cluster identitiy label on the plot.
labelSize

Size of the text label.
legend

Show legends in paneled plots. Defaults to FALSE because typically these look too busy and the legends can get cut off.
returnAsList

Return plots as a list.

Value

No return, only graphical output.

See also

Seurat::FeaturePlot().

Examples

load(system.file("extdata/seurat.rda", package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# seurat
plotFeatureTSNE(seurat, features = "PC1")
